conclusion: Identify the charges and their positions: A and B have +q, C and D have -q.
The intersection of the diagonals is the center of the square.
The distance from the center to any vertex is L/sqrt(2).
Electric field E due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Calculate electric field for charges at A and B: E_A = E_B = 2kq/L^2.
Calculate electric field for charges at C and D: E_C = E_D = -2kq/L^2.
Electric field due to +q at A and B points towards the center.
Electric field due to -q at C and D points away from the center.
Electric fields from A and B are equal in magnitude and direction.
Electric fields from C and D are equal in magnitude but opposite in direction to A and B.
Electric fields from A and B add up to 4kq/L^2.
Electric fields from C and D cancel out fields from A and B to -4kq/L^2.
Net electric field at the center is 0.
The electric field strength at the intersection of the diagonals of the square is 0.
